<|endoftext|>/*
Given a vector of integers, sort the integers that are between 1 and 9 inclusive,
reverse the resulting vector, and then replace each digit by its corresponding name from
"One", "Two", "Three", "Four", "Five", "Six", "Seven", "Eight", "Nine".

For example:
  arr = {2, 1, 1, 4, 5, 8, 2, 3}   
        -> sort arr -> {1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8} 
        -> reverse arr -> {8, 5, 4, 3, 2, 2, 1, 1}
  return {"Eight", "Five", "Four", "Three", "Two", "Two", "One", "One"}

  If the vector is empty, return an empty vector:
  arr = {}
  return {}

  If the vector has any strange number ignore it:
  arr = {1, -1, 55} 
        -> sort arr -> {-1, 1, 55}
        -> reverse arr -> {55, 1, -1}
  return = {"One"}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
#include<map>
#include<algorithm>
usingnamespace std;
vector < string > by_length(vector < int > bd4) {
   
    vector < string > res;
    
    for(int i = 0; i < bd4.size(); i++) {
        res.push_back(bd4[i]);
    }
    
    res.sort();
    
    for(int i = 0; i < bd4.size(); i++) {
        res.erase(res.begin() + i);
    }
    
    return res;
}

}

If several letters have the same occurrence, return all of them.

Example:

histogram("a b c a b") == {{"a", 2}, {"b", 2}}
histogram("b b b b a") == {{"b", 4}}
histogram("") == {}

#include<string>

map < char, int > histogram(string test) {
    map < char, int > count = {
        }
   , out = {
        }

    for (int d = 0; d < test.length(); d++)

         count [ test [ d ] ] = 1;
         out [ test [ d ] ] = 1;

       else

         if ( count [ test [ d ] ] > max )

               count [ test [ d ] ] = count [ test [ d ] ] + 1;
               out [ test [ d ] ] = it;

           }
         }
       }
     }
    return out;
}

of nums.

    long long c76389H, min;

}

    string l1 = lst [ 0 ] + lst [ 1 ];
    int R, count = 0;
    bool can = true;
    for (R = 0; R < l1.length(); R++)
     {
        if (l1 [ R ] =='') count+=1;
        if (l1 [ R ] =='') count-=1;
        if (count < 0) can = false;
       
     }
    if (can) {
        string l2 = lst [ 0 ] + lst [ 1 ];

                        }
                        if (can6)
                        {
                            string l7 = l5 [ R + 1 ] + l5 [ R ];
                            bool can7 = true;
                            for (R = 0; R < l7.length(); R++)
                            {
                                if (l7 [ R ] =='') can7 = false;
                            }
                            if (can7)
                            {
                                string l8 = l6 [ R + 1 ] + l6 [ R ];

                                for (R = 0; R < l8.length(); R++)
                                {
                                    if (l8 [ R ] =='') can8 = false;
                                }
                                if (can8)

                                    string l9 = l7 [ R + 1 ] + l7 [ R ];

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a grid with N rows and N columns (N >= 2) and a positive integer k, 
each cell of the grid contains a value. Every integer in the range {1, N * N}
inclusive appears exactly once on the cells of the grid.

You have to find the minimum path of length k in the grid. You can start
from any cell, and in each step you can move to any of the neighbor cells,
in other words, you can go to cells which share an edge with you current
cell.
Please note that a path of length k means visiting exactly k cells (not
necessarily distinct).
You CANNOT go off the grid.
A path A (of length k) is considered less than a path B (of length k) if
after making the ordered vectors of the values on the cells that A and B go
through (let's call them lst_A and lst_B), lst_A is lexicographically less
than lst_B, in other words, there exist an integer index i (1 <= i <= k)
such that lst_A[i] < lst_B[i] and for any j (1 <= j < i) we have
lst_A[j] = lst_B[j].
It is guaranteed that the answer is unique.
Return an ordered vector of the values on the cells that the minimum path go through.

Examples:

    Input: grid = { {1,2,3}, {4,5,6}, {7,8,9}}, k = 3
    Output: {1, 2, 1}

    Input: grid = { {5,9,3}, {4,1,6}, {7,8,2}}, k = 1
    Output: {1}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include<vector>
usingnamespace std;
vector < int > minPath(vector < vector < int > > Vs7v, int k) {
    int i, j, x, y, min;
    for (i = 0; i < Vs7v.size(); i++)
    for (j = 0; j < Vs7v [ i ].size(); j++)
    if (Vs7v [ i ] [ j ] == 1) {
        x = i; y = j;
        }
   
    min = Vs7v [ x ][ y ];
    
    if (min == Vs7v [ x ][ y ]) {
        minPath (Vs7v, k - 1);

#include <stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
usingnamespace std;
int sum_squares(vector < float > lst) {
   
    int sum=0;
    for(int i=0;i<lst.size();i++){
        sum+=pow((float)lst[i],2.0);
    }
    return sum;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a function that returns true if the last character
of a given string is an alphabetical character and is not
a part of a word, and false otherwise.
Note: "word" is a group of characters separated by space.

Examples:
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pie")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pi e")  true
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("apple pi e ")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_letter("")  false 
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include<string>
usingnamespace std;
bool check_if_last_char_is_a_letter(string txt) {
    if (txt.length() == 0) return false;
    char E4T = txt [ txt.length() - 1 ];
   
    if (E4T == 'a' || E4T == 'e' || E4T == 'i' || E4T == 'o' || E4T == 'u' || E4T == 'A' || E4T == 'E' || E4T == 'I' || E4T == 'O' || E4T == 'U')
        return true;
    else
        return false;
}

/*
Create a function that returns true if the last character
of a given string is a digit and is not
a part of a word, and false otherwise.
Note: "word" is a group of characters separated by space.

Examples:
check_if_last_char_is_a_digit("apple pie")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_digit("apple pi e")  true
check_if_last_char_is_a_digit("apple pi e ")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_digit("")  false 
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include<string>
usingnamespace std;
bool check_if_last_char_is_a_digit(string txt) {
    if (txt.length() == 0) return false;
    char E4T = txt [ txt.length() - 1 ];
   
    if (E4T == '0' || E4T == '1' || E4T == '2' || E4T == '3' || E4T == '4' || E4T == '5' || E4T == '6' || E4T == '7' || E4T == '8' || E4T == '9')
        return true;
    else
        return false;
}

/*
Create a function that returns true if the last character
of a given string is a space and is not
a part of a word, and false otherwise.
Note: "word" is a group of characters separated by space.

Examples:
check_if_last_char_is_a_space("apple pie")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_space("apple pi e")  true
check_if_last_char_is_a_space("apple pi e ")  false
check_if_last_char_is_a_space("")  false 
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include<string>
usingnamespace std;
bool check_if_last_char_is_a_space(string txt) {
    if (txt.length() == 0) return false;
    char E4T = txt [ txt.length() - 1 ];
   
    if (E4T =='' || E4T == '\t' || E4T == '\n' || E4T == '\r')
        return true;
    else
        return false;
}

Examples:

string int_to_mini_romank(int number) {
    string current = "";
    vector < string > rep = {
        "m", "cm", "d", "cd", "c", "xc", "l", "xl", "x", "ix", "v", "iv", "i"}
    ;
    vector < int > num = {
        1000, 900, 500, 400, 100, 90, 50, 40, 10, 9, 5, 4, 1}
    ;
    int Vd2 = 0;
    while (number > 0)
   
    {
        Vd2 += num[number % 1000];
        number /= 1000;
    }
    
    string roman = "";
    
    for (int i = 0; i < Vd2; i++) {
        roman.push_back(rep[Vd2 - i]);
    }
    
    return roman;
}

Filter given vector of any python values only for integers
>>> filter_integers({"a", 3.14, 5})
{5}
>>> filter_integers({1, 2, 3, "abc", {}, {}})
{1, 2, 3}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
#include<boost/any.hpp>
#include<list> typedef std :: list < boost :: any > list_any;
using namespace std;
vector < int > filter_integers(list_any values) {
    list_any :: iterator I2;
   
    for(I2 = values.begin(); I2!= values.end(); ++I2)
    {
        if(boost::any_cast<int>(*I2) >= 0)
        {
            values.erase(I2);
        }
    }
    return values;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return true if a given number is prime, and false otherwise.
>>> is_prime(6)
false
>>> is_prime(101)
true
>>> is_prime(11)
true
>>> is_prime(13441)
true
>>> is_prime(61)
true
>>> is_prime(4)
false
>>> is_prime(1)
false
*/
#include <stdio.h>
usingnamespace std;
bool is_prime(long long n) {
    if (n < 2) return false;
   
    if (n % 2 == 0) return false;
    
    long long m = n / 2;
    
    for (long long i = 2; i <= m; i++) {
        if (n % i == 0) return false;
    }
    
    return true;
}

    if (n < 2) return false;
   
    if (n % 2 == 0) return false;
    
    long long m = n / 2;
    
    for (long long i = 2; i <= m; i++) {
        if (n % i == 0) return false;
    }
    
    if (is_prime(m)) return true;
    
    return false;
}

using namespace std;
double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns only only zero point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_zero only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    std::vector<double> dxs;
    for (size_t i = 1; i < xs.size(); i++) {
        dxs.push_back(xs[i] * i);
    }

    auto func = [&](double x) {
        double result = 0.0;
        for (size_t i = 0; i < xs.size(); i++) {
            result += xs[i] * std::pow(x, i);
        }
        return result;
    };

    auto derivative = [&](double x) {
        double result = 0.0;
        for (size_t i = 0; i < dxs.size(); i++) {
            result += dxs[i] * std::pow(x, i);
        }
        return result;
    };

    double zero = func(xs[0]);
    for (size_t i = 1; i < xs.size(); i++) {
        double derivative = derivative(func(xs[i]));
        if (derivative == zero) {
            zero = derivative;
        }
    }
    return zero;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return sorted unique elements in a vector
>>> unique({5, 3, 5, 2, 3, 3, 9, 0, 123})
{0, 2, 3, 5, 9, 123}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
usingnamespace std;
vector < int > unique(vector < int > l) {
    vector < int > yng = {
        }
    ;
   
    vector < int > yng2 = {
        l.begin(),
        l.end()
    };
    
    sort(l.begin(), l.end());
    
    vector < int >::iterator it;
    
    for(it = l.begin(); it!= l.end(); ++it) {
        if(!std::find(yng.begin(), yng.end(), *it)) {
            yng.push_back(*it);
        }
    }
    
    sort(yng.begin(), yng.end());
    
    for(it = yng.begin(); it!= yng.end(); ++it) {
        if(!std::find(yng2.begin(), yng2.end(), *it)) {
            yng2.push_back(*it);
        }
    }
    
    sort(yng2.begin(), yng2.end());
    
    vector < int > yng3 = {
        yng2.begin(),
        yng2.end()
    };
    
    return yng3;
}

/*
Return average of elements in the vector.
>>> average({1, 2, 3})
1.5
>>> average({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
3.5
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
usingnamespace std;
float average(vector < float > l) {
   
   float sum = 0;
   for(int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      sum += l[i];
   }
   return sum / l.size();
}

/*
Return standard deviation of elements in the vector.
>>> std({1, 2, 3})
1.5
>>> std({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
2.5
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
usingnamespace std;
float std(vector < float > l) {
   
   float sum = 0;
   for(int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      sum += pow(l[i] - average(l), 2);
   }
   return sqrt(sum / l.size());
}

/*
Return variance of elements in the vector.
>>> variance({1, 2, 3})
1.5
>>> variance({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})
2.5
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
usingnamespace std;
float variance(vector < float > l) {
   
   float sum = 0;
   for(int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++) {
      sum += pow(l[i] - average(l), 2);
   }
   return pow(sum / l.size(), 0.5);
}

<|endoftext|>/*
This function takes a vector l and returns a vector l' such that
l' is identical to l in the odd indicies, while its values at the even indicies are equal
to the values of the even indicies of l, but sorted.
>>> sort_even({1, 2, 3})
{1, 2, 3}
>>> sort_even({5, 6, 3, 4})
{3, 6, 5, 4}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
usingnamespace std;
vector < float > sort_even(vector < float > l) {
    vector < float > out = {
        }
    ;
    vector < float > even = {
        }
    ;
    for (int F = 0; F * 2 < l.size(); F++)
   
    {
        if (F % 2 == 0)
        {
            even.push_back(l.at(F));
        }
        else
        {
            out.push_back(l.at(F));
        }
    }
    sort(even.begin(), even.end());
    sort(out.begin(), out.end());
    return out;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
prime_fib returns n-th number that is a Fibonacci number and it's also prime.
>>> prime_fib(1)
2
>>> prime_fib(2)
3
>>> prime_fib(3)
5
>>> prime_fib(4)
13
>>> prime_fib(5)
89
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include <iostream>
#include <random>


using namespace std;

bool miller_rabin(long long n, int k = 10) {
    if (n < 2) {
        return false;
    }
    if (n == 2 || n == 3) {
        return true;
    }
    if (n % 2 == 0) {
        return false;
    }

    int r = 0;
    long long d = n - 1;
    while (d % 2 == 0) {
        r++;
        d /= 2;
    }

    std::random_device rd;
    std::mt19937_64 gen(rd());
    std::uniform_int_distribution<long long> dis(2, n - 2);

    for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
        long long a = dis(gen);
        long long x = 1;
        while (d > 0) {
            if (d % 2 == 1) {
                x = (x * a) % n;
            }
            d /= 2;
        }
        if (x == 1) {
            return false;
        }
    }
    return true;
}

#include <stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<algorithm>

bool same_chars(string s0, string s1) {

    return false;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return true is vector elements are monotonically increasing or decreasing.
>>> monotonic({1, 2, 4, 20})
true
>>> monotonic({1, 20, 4, 10})
false
>>> monotonic({4, 1, 0, -10})
true
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include<vector>
usingnamespace std;
bool monotonic(vector < float > l) {
    int incr, decr;
    incr = 0; decr = 0;
    for (int L = 1; L < l.size(); L++)
   
    {
        if (incr == 0)
        {
            if (l.at(L) > l.at(L - 1))
            {
                incr = 1;
            }
            else
            {
                decr = 1;
            }
        }
        else
        {
            if (l.at(L) < l.at(L + 1))
            {
                incr = 0;
            }
            else
            {
                decr = 0;
            }
        }
    }
    return incr == decr;
}

      return 53;

<|endoftext|>/*
xs represent coefficients of a polynomial.
xs{0} + xs{1} * x + xs{2} * x^2 +....
 Return derivative of this polynomial in the same form.
>>> derivative({3, 1, 2, 4, 5})
{1, 4, 12, 20}
>>> derivative({1, 2, 3})
{2, 6}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
usingnamespace std;
vector < float > derivative(vector < float > xs) {
   
   vector < float > xs_copy(xs);
   
   float xs_sum = 0;
   
   for (int i = 1; i < xs.size(); i++) {
      xs_sum += xs_copy[i] * xs_copy[i];
   }
   
   float xs_derivative = xs_sum / xs.size();
   
   return xs_derivative;
}

/*
xs represent coefficients of a polynomial.
xs {0} + xs{1} * x + xs{2} * x^2 +....
 Return inverse of this polynomial in the same form.
>>> inverse({3, 1, 2, 4, 5})
{3, 1, 2, 4, 5}
>>> inverse({1, 2, 3})
{1, 2, 3}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
usingnamespace std;
vector < float > inverse(vector < float > xs) {
   
   vector < float > xs_copy(xs);
   
   float xs_sum = 0;
   
   for (int i = 1; i < xs.size(); i++) {
      xs_sum += xs_copy[i] * xs_copy[i];
   }
   
   float xs_inverse = xs_sum / xs.size();
   
   return xs_inverse;
}

#include<math.h>
#include<vector>

vector < float > inverse(vector < float > xs) {
   
   vector < float > xs_copy(xs);
   
   float xs_sum = 0;
   
   for (int i = 1; i < xs.size(); i++) {

   }
   
   float xs_inverse = xs_sum / xs.size();
   
   return xs_inverse;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Circular shift the digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift
and return the result as a string.
If shift > number of digits, return digits reversed.
>>> circular_shift(12, 1)
"21"
>>> circular_shift(12, 2)
"12"
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include<string>
usingnamespace std;
string circular_shift(int x, int shift) {
    string SQ;
    SQ = to_string(x);
    if (SQ.length() < shift)
   
        for(int i = shift; i < SQ.length(); i++)
            SQ[i] = '0' + SQ[i];
    return SQ;
}

Write a function that returns true if the object q will fly, and false otherwise.

<|endoftext|>/*
Write a function that returns true if the given number is the multiplication of 3 prime numbers
and false otherwise.
Knowing that (a) is less then 100. 
Example:
is_multiply_prime(30) == true
30 = 2 * 3 * 5
*/
#include <stdio.h>
usingnamespace std;
bool is_multiply_prime(int a) {
    int num = 0;
    for (int Q = 2; Q * Q <= a; Q++)
    while (a % Q == 0 and a > Q)
   
    {
        if (a % Q == 0)
        {
            num++;
        }
    }
    if (num == 3)
    {
        return true;
    }
    else
    {
        return false;
    }
}

}

Return None if there is no such element.

next_smallest({1, 2, 3, 4, 5}) == 2
next_smallest({5, 1, 4, 3, 2}) == 2
next_smallest({}) == None
next_smallest({1, 1}) == None

        Ym1.push_back(Ym2[i]);
    }
    
    sort(Ym1.begin(), Ym1.end());
    
    return Ym1[Ym1.size()-2];
}

#include <stdio.h>
#include<vector>

int skjkasdkd(vector < int > lst) {
    int largest = 0;
    for (int R = 0; R < lst.size(); R++)
    if (lst [ R ] > largest)
     {
        bool prime = true;
        for (int j = 2; j * j <= lst [ R ]; j++)

        if (prime)

}
